item.title: How to Make Code Comments in Markdown
item.description: How to Comment a Markdown File Markdown doesn’t include specific syntax for comments, but there is a workaround using the reference style links syntax. Using this syntax, the comments will not be output to the resulting HTML. Here are a few examples: []: # (This is a comment) []: # "And this is a comment" []: # 'Also this is a comment' [//]: # (Yet another comment) [comment]: # (Still another comment) Each of these lines works the same way:

item.title: Setting up my Hugo Website
item.description: Moving my Website to Hugo I’ve decided to move my website off of WordPress and on to a static site generator. After building sites for several clients using Jekyll, I thought it would be nice to try something new. Since my website has been very neglected, most of the content is outdated so I’m not going to bother moving much of it over. If I were, I might try the wordpress-to-hugo-exporter exporter.
